intro: Kopsiopsis tuberosa, commonly known as the tuberous kopsiopsis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, often blooming in late summer. Its fleshy, tuberous roots are adapted to store water, allowing it to survive in arid conditions. Kopsiopsis tuberosa is often cultivated in rock gardens and as a decorative plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
